text: Also I swore to them in the wilderness that I would scatter them among the nations and disperse them among the lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they had not observed My ordinances, but had rejected My statutes and had profaned My sabbaths, and their eyes were on the idols of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also gave them statutes that were not good and ordinances by which they could not live;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I pronounced them unclean because of their gifts, in that they caused all their firstborn to pass through the fire so that I might make them desolate, in order that they might know that I am the Lord.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore, son of man, speak to the house of Israel and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Yet in this your fathers have blasphemed Me by acting treacherously against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I had brought them into the land which I swore to give to them, then they saw every high hill and every leafy tree, and they offered there their sacrifices and there they presented the provocation of their offering. There also they made their soothing aroma and there they poured out their drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said to them, ‘What is the high place to which you go?’ So its name is called Bamah to this day.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Will you defile yourselves after the manner of your fathers and play the harlot after their detestable things?
speaker: Narrator

text: When you offer your gifts, when you cause your sons to pass through the fire, you are defiling yourselves with all your idols to this day. And shall I be inquired of by you, O house of Israel? As I live,” declares the Lord God, “I will not be inquired of by you.
speaker: Narrator

text: What comes into your mind will not come about, when you say: ‘We will be like the nations, like the tribes of the lands, serving wood and stone.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “As I live,” declares the Lord God, “surely with a mighty hand and with an outstretched arm and with wrath poured out, I shall be king over you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands where you are scattered, with a mighty hand and with an outstretched arm and with wrath poured out;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples, and there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.
speaker: Narrator

text: As I entered into judgment with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so I will enter into judgment with you,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will make you pass under the rod, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will purge from you the rebels and those who transgress against Me; I will bring them out of the land where they sojourn, but they will not enter the land of Israel. Thus you will know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for you, O house of Israel,” thus says the Lord God, “Go, serve everyone his idols; but later you will surely listen to Me, and My holy name you will profane no longer with your gifts and with your idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: For on My holy mountain, on the high mountain of Israel,” declares the Lord God, “there the whole house of Israel, all of them, will serve Me in the land; there I will accept them and there I will seek your contributions and the choicest of your gifts, with all your holy things.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a soothing aroma I will accept you when I bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands where you are scattered; and I will prove Myself holy among you in the sight of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will know that I am the Lord, when I bring you into the land of Israel, into the land which I swore to give to your forefathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: There you will remember your ways and all your deeds with which you have defiled yourselves; and you will loathe yourselves in your own sight for all the evil things that you have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will know that I am the Lord when I have dealt with you for My name’s sake, not according to your evil ways or according to your corrupt deeds, O house of Israel,” declares the Lord God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, set your face toward Teman, and speak out against the south and prophesy against the forest land of the Negev,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say to the forest of the Negev, ‘Hear the word of the Lord: thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I am about to kindle a fire in you, and it will consume every green tree in you, as well as every dry tree; the blazing flame will not be quenched and the whole surface from south to north will be burned by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All flesh will see that I, the Lord, have kindled it; it shall not be quenched.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, “Ah Lord God! They are saying of me, ‘Is he not just speaking parables?’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, set your face toward Jerusalem, and speak against the sanctuaries and prophesy against the land of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and say to the land of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord, “Behold, I am against you; and I will draw My sword out of its sheath and cut off from you the righteous and the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because I will cut off from you the righteous and the wicked, therefore My sword will go forth from its sheath against all flesh from south to north.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus all flesh will know that I, the Lord, have drawn My sword out of its sheath. It will not return to its sheath again.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, son of man, groan with breaking heart and bitter grief, groan in their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they say to you, ‘Why do you groan?’ you shall say, ‘Because of the news that is coming; and every heart will melt, all hands will be feeble, every spirit will faint and all knees will be weak as water. Behold, it comes and it will happen,’ declares the Lord God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord.’ Say,
‘A sword, a sword sharpened
And also polished!
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Sharpened to make a slaughter,
Polished to flash like lightning!’
Or shall we rejoice, the rod of My son despising every tree?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is given to be polished, that it may be handled; the sword is sharpened and polished, to give it into the hand of the slayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cry out and wail, son of man; for it is against My people, it is against all the officials of Israel. They are delivered over to the sword with My people, therefore strike your thigh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is a testing; and what if even the rod which despises will be no more?” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You therefore, son of man, prophesy and clap your hands together; and let the sword be doubled the third time, the sword for the slain. It is the sword for the great one slain, which surrounds them,
speaker: Narrator

text: that their hearts may melt, and many fall at all their gates. I have given the glittering sword. Ah! It is made for striking like lightning, it is wrapped up in readiness for slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show yourself sharp, go to the right; set yourself; go to the left, wherever your edge is appointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also clap My hands together, and I will appease My wrath; I, the Lord, have spoken.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for you, son of man, make two ways for the sword of the king of Babylon to come; both of them will go out of one land. And make a signpost; make it at the head of the way to the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall mark a way for the sword to come to Rabbah of the sons of Ammon, and to Judah into fortified Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the king of Babylon stands at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination; he shakes the arrows, he consults the household idols, he looks at the liver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into his right hand came the divination, ‘Jerusalem,’ to set battering rams, to open the mouth for slaughter, to lift up the voice with a battle cry, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up ramps, to build a siege wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will be to them like a false divination in their eyes; they have sworn solemn oaths. But he brings iniquity to remembrance, that they may be seized.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore, thus says the Lord God, ‘Because you have made your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are uncovered, so that in all your deeds your sins appear—because you have come to remembrance, you will be seized with the hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, O slain, wicked one, the prince of Israel, whose day has come, in the time of the punishment of the end,’
speaker: Narrator

text: thus says the Lord God, ‘Remove the turban and take off the crown; this will no longer be the same. Exalt that which is low and abase that which is high.

speaker: Narrator

text: “And you, son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord God concerning the sons of Ammon and concerning their reproach,’ and say: ‘A sword, a sword is drawn, polished for the slaughter, to cause it to consume, that it may be like lightning—
speaker: Narrator

text: while they see for you false visions, while they divine lies for you—to place you on the necks of the wicked who are slain, whose day has come, in the time of the punishment of the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return it to its sheath. In the place where you were created, in the land of your origin, I will judge you.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: You will be fuel for the fire; your blood will be in the midst of the land. You will not be remembered, for I, the Lord, have spoken.’”

text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the bloody city? Then cause her to know all her abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “A city shedding blood in her midst, so that her time will come, and that makes idols, contrary to her interest, for defilement!
speaker: Narrator

text: You have become guilty by the blood which you have shed, and defiled by your idols which you have made. Thus you have brought your day near and have come to your years; therefore I have made you a reproach to the nations and a mocking to all the lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who are near and those who are far from you will mock you, you of ill repute, full of turmoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Behold, the rulers of Israel, each according to his power, have been in you for the purpose of shedding blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have treated father and mother lightly within you. The alien they have oppressed in your midst; the fatherless and the widow they have wronged in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have despised My holy things and profaned My sabbaths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slanderous men have been in you for the purpose of shedding blood, and in you they have eaten at the mountain shrines. In your midst they have committed acts of lewdness.
speaker: Narrator

text: In you they have uncovered their fathers’ nakedness; in you they have humbled her who was unclean in her menstrual impurity.
speaker: Narrator

text: One has committed abomination with his neighbor’s wife and another has lewdly defiled his daughter-in-law. And another in you has humbled his sister, his father’s daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: In you they have taken bribes to shed blood; you have taken interest and profits, and you have injured your neighbors for gain by oppression, and you have forgotten Me,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Behold, then, I smite My hand at your dishonest gain which you have acquired and at the bloodshed which is among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Can your heart endure, or can your hands be strong in the days that I will deal with you? I, the Lord, have spoken and will act.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will scatter you among the nations and I will disperse you through the lands, and I will consume your uncleanness from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will profane yourself in the sight of the nations, and you will know that I am the Lord.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, the house of Israel has become dross to Me; all of them are bronze and tin and iron and lead in the furnace; they are the dross of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, thus says the Lord God, ‘Because all of you have become dross, therefore, behold, I am going to gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they gather silver and bronze and iron and lead and tin into the furnace to blow fire on it in order to melt it, so I will gather you in My anger and in My wrath and I will lay you there and melt you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will gather you and blow on you with the fire of My wrath, and you will be melted in the midst of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: As silver is melted in the furnace, so you will be melted in the midst of it; and you will know that I, the Lord, have poured out My wrath on you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, say to her, ‘You are a land that is not cleansed or rained on in the day of indignation.’
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a conspiracy of her prophets in her midst like a roaring lion tearing the prey. They have devoured lives; they have taken treasure and precious things; they have made many widows in the midst of her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her priests have done violence to My law and have profaned My holy things; they have made no distinction between the holy and the profane, and they have not taught the difference between the unclean and the clean; and they hide their eyes from My sabbaths, and I am profaned among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her princes within her are like wolves tearing the prey, by shedding blood and destroying lives in order to get dishonest gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her prophets have smeared whitewash for them, seeing false visions and divining lies for them, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord God,’ when the Lord has not spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of the land have practiced oppression and committed robbery, and they have wronged the poor and needy and have oppressed the sojourner without justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: I searched for a man among them who would build up the wall and stand in the gap before Me for the land, so that I would not destroy it; but I found no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I have poured out My indignation on them; I have consumed them with the fire of My wrath; their way I have brought upon their heads,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, there were two women, the daughters of one mother;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they played the harlot in Egypt. They played the harlot in their youth; there their breasts were pressed and there their virgin bosom was handled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their names were Oholah the elder and Oholibah her sister. And they became Mine, and they bore sons and daughters. And as for their names, Samaria is Oholah and Jerusalem is Oholibah.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Oholah played the harlot while she was Mine; and she lusted after her lovers, after the Assyrians, her neighbors,
speaker: Narrator

text: who were clothed in purple, governors and officials, all of them desirable young men, horsemen riding on horses.
speaker: Narrator

text: She bestowed her harlotries on them, all of whom were the choicest men of Assyria; and with all whom she lusted after, with all their idols she defiled herself.
speaker: Narrator

text: She did not forsake her harlotries from the time in Egypt; for in her youth men had lain with her, and they handled her virgin bosom and poured out their lust on her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I gave her into the hand of her lovers, into the hand of the Assyrians, after whom she lusted.
speaker: Narrator

text: They uncovered her nakedness; they took her sons and her daughters, but they slew her with the sword. Thus she became a byword among women, and they executed judgments on her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now her sister Oholibah saw this, yet she was more corrupt in her lust than she, and her harlotries were more than the harlotries of her sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: She lusted after the Assyrians, governors and officials, the ones near, magnificently dressed, horsemen riding on horses, all of them desirable young men.
speaker: Narrator

text: I saw that she had defiled herself; they both took the same way.
speaker: Narrator

text: So she increased her harlotries. And she saw men portrayed on the wall, images of the Chaldeans portrayed with vermilion,
speaker: Narrator

text: girded with belts on their loins, with flowing turbans on their heads, all of them looking like officers, like the Babylonians in Chaldea, the land of their birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she saw them she lusted after them and sent messengers to them in Chaldea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Babylonians came to her to the bed of love and defiled her with their harlotry. And when she had been defiled by them, she became disgusted with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: She uncovered her harlotries and uncovered her nakedness; then I became disgusted with her, as I had become disgusted with her sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet she multiplied her harlotries, remembering the days of her youth, when she played the harlot in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: She lusted after their paramours, whose flesh is like the flesh of donkeys and whose issue is like the issue of horses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you longed for the lewdness of your youth, when the Egyptians handled your bosom because of the breasts of your youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore, O Oholibah, thus says the Lord God, ‘Behold I will arouse your lovers against you, from whom you were alienated, and I will bring them against you from every side:
speaker: Narrator

text: the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, Pekod and Shoa and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them; desirable young men, governors and officials all of them, officers and men of renown, all of them riding on horses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will come against you with weapons, chariots and wagons, and with a company of peoples. They will set themselves against you on every side with buckler and shield and helmet; and I will commit the judgment to them, and they will judge you according to their customs.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set My jealousy against you, that they may deal with you in wrath. They will remove your nose and your ears; and your survivors will fall by the sword. They will take your sons and your daughters; and your survivors will be consumed by the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will also strip you of your clothes and take away your beautiful jewels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I will make your lewdness and your harlotry brought from the land of Egypt to cease from you, so that you will not lift up your eyes to them or remember Egypt anymore.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord God, ‘Behold, I will give you into the hand of those whom you hate, into the hand of those from whom you were alienated.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will deal with you in hatred, take all your property, and leave you naked and bare. And the nakedness of your harlotries will be uncovered, both your lewdness and your harlotries.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things will be done to you because you have played the harlot with the nations, because you have defiled yourself with their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have walked in the way of your sister; therefore I will give her cup into your hand.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord God,
‘You will drink your sister’s cup,
Which is deep and wide.
You will be laughed at and held in derision;
It contains much.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘You will be filled with drunkenness and sorrow,
The cup of horror and desolation,
The cup of your sister Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘You will drink it and drain it.
Then you will gnaw its fragments
And tear your breasts;
for I have spoken,’ declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, thus says the Lord God, ‘Because you have forgotten Me and cast Me behind your back, bear now the punishment of your lewdness and your harlotries.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the Lord said to me, “Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then declare to them their abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands. Thus they have committed adultery with their idols and even caused their sons, whom they bore to Me, to pass through the fire to them as food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, they have done this to Me: they have defiled My sanctuary on the same day and have profaned My sabbaths.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when they had slaughtered their children for their idols, they entered My sanctuary on the same day to profane it; and lo, thus they did within My house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Furthermore, they have even sent for men who come from afar, to whom a messenger was sent; and lo, they came—for whom you bathed, painted your eyes and decorated yourselves with ornaments;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you sat on a splendid couch with a table arranged before it on which you had set My incense and My oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sound of a carefree multitude was with her; and drunkards were brought from the wilderness with men of the common sort. And they put bracelets on the hands of the women and beautiful crowns on their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then I said concerning her who was worn out by adulteries, ‘Will they now commit adultery with her when she is thus?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But they went in to her as they would go in to a harlot. Thus they went in to Oholah and to Oholibah, the lewd women.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they, righteous men, will judge them with the judgment of adulteresses and with the judgment of women who shed blood, because they are adulteresses and blood is on their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For thus says the Lord God, ‘Bring up a company against them and give them over to terror and plunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: The company will stone them with stones and cut them down with their swords; they will slay their sons and their daughters and burn their houses with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I will make lewdness cease from the land, that all women may be admonished and not commit lewdness as you have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your lewdness will be requited upon you, and you will bear the penalty of worshiping your idols; thus you will know that I am the Lord God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth of the month, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, write the name of the day, this very day. The king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Speak a parable to the rebellious house and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord God,
“Put on the pot, put it on and also pour water in it;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Take the choicest of the flock,
And also pile wood under the pot.
Make it boil vigorously.
Also seethe its bones in it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Therefore, thus says the Lord God,
“Woe to the bloody city,
To the pot in which there is rust
And whose rust has not gone out of it!
Take out of it piece after piece,
Without making a choice.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“That it may cause wrath to come up to take vengeance,
I have put her blood on the bare rock,
That it may not be covered.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Therefore, thus says the Lord God,
“Woe to the bloody city!
I also will make the pile great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Heap on the wood, kindle the fire,
Boil the flesh well
And mix in the spices,
And let the bones be burned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Then set it empty on its coals
So that it may be hot
And its bronze may glow
And its filthiness may be melted in it,
Its rust consumed.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“In your filthiness is lewdness.
Because I would have cleansed you,
Yet you are not clean,
You will not be cleansed from your filthiness again
Until I have spent My wrath on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, the Lord, have spoken; it is coming and I will act. I will not relent, and I will not pity and I will not be sorry; according to your ways and according to your deeds I will judge you,” declares the Lord God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, behold, I am about to take from you the desire of your eyes with a blow; but you shall not mourn and you shall not weep, and your tears shall not come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Groan silently; make no mourning for the dead. Bind on your turban and put your shoes on your feet, and do not cover your mustache and do not eat the bread of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I spoke to the people in the morning, and in the evening my wife died. And in the morning I did as I was commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people said to me, “Will you not tell us what these things that you are doing mean for us?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said to them, “The word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Speak to the house of Israel, “Thus says the Lord God, ‘Behold, I am about to profane My sanctuary, the pride of your power, the desire of your eyes and the delight of your soul; and your sons and your daughters whom you have left behind will fall by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will do as I have done; you will not cover your mustache and you will not eat the bread of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your turbans will be on your heads and your shoes on your feet. You will not mourn and you will not weep, but you will rot away in your iniquities and you will groan to one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Ezekiel will be a sign to you; according to all that he has done you will do; when it comes, then you will know that I am the Lord God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘As for you, son of man, will it not be on the day when I take from them their stronghold, the joy of their pride, the desire of their eyes and their heart’s delight, their sons and their daughters,
speaker: Narrator

text: that on that day he who escapes will come to you with information for your ears?
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day your mouth will be opened to him who escaped, and you will speak and be mute no longer. Thus you will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am the Lord.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, set your face toward the sons of Ammon and prophesy against them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say to the sons of Ammon, ‘Hear the word of the Lord God! Thus says the Lord God, “Because you said, ‘Aha!’ against My sanctuary when it was profaned, and against the land of Israel when it was made desolate, and against the house of Judah when they went into exile,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, behold, I am going to give you to the sons of the east for a possession, and they will set their encampments among you and make their dwellings among you; they will eat your fruit and drink your milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make Rabbah a pasture for camels and the sons of Ammon a resting place for flocks. Thus you will know that I am the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord God, “Because you have clapped your hands and stamped your feet and rejoiced with all the scorn of your soul against the land of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, behold, I have stretched out My hand against you and I will give you for spoil to the nations. And I will cut you off from the peoples and make you perish from the lands; I will destroy you. Thus you will know that I am the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Because Moab and Seir say, ‘Behold, the house of Judah is like all the nations,’
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, behold, I am going to deprive the flank of Moab of its cities, of its cities which are on its frontiers, the glory of the land, Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon and Kiriathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will give it for a possession along with the sons of Ammon to the sons of the east, so that the sons of Ammon will not be remembered among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I will execute judgments on Moab, and they will know that I am the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Because Edom has acted against the house of Judah by taking vengeance, and has incurred grievous guilt, and avenged themselves upon them,”
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore thus says the Lord God, “I will also stretch out My hand against Edom and cut off man and beast from it. And I will lay it waste; from Teman even to Dedan they will fall by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lay My vengeance on Edom by the hand of My people Israel. Therefore, they will act in Edom according to My anger and according to My wrath; thus they will know My vengeance,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Because the Philistines have acted in revenge and have taken vengeance with scorn of soul to destroy with everlasting enmity,”
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I will stretch out My hand against the Philistines, even cut off the Cherethites and destroy the remnant of the seacoast.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will execute great vengeance on them with wrathful rebukes; and they will know that I am the Lord when I lay My vengeance on them.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the eleventh year, on the first of the month, the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, because Tyre has said concerning Jerusalem, ‘Aha, the gateway of the peoples is broken; it has opened to me. I shall be filled, now that she is laid waste,’
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore thus says the Lord God, ‘Behold, I am against you, O Tyre, and I will bring up many nations against you, as the sea brings up its waves.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will destroy the walls of Tyre and break down her towers; and I will scrape her debris from her and make her a bare rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: She will be a place for the spreading of nets in the midst of the sea, for I have spoken,’ declares the Lord God, ‘and she will become spoil for the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also her daughters who are on the mainland will be slain by the sword, and they will know that I am the Lord.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I will bring upon Tyre from the north Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, with horses, chariots, cavalry and a great army.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will slay your daughters on the mainland with the sword; and he will make siege walls against you, cast up a ramp against you and raise up a large shield against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The blow of his battering rams he will direct against your walls, and with his axes he will break down your towers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the multitude of his horses, the dust raised by them will cover you; your walls will shake at the noise of cavalry and wagons and chariots when he enters your gates as men enter a city that is breached.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the hoofs of his horses he will trample all your streets. He will slay your people with the sword; and your strong pillars will come down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they will make a spoil of your riches and a prey of your merchandise, break down your walls and destroy your pleasant houses, and throw your stones and your timbers and your debris into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I will silence the sound of your songs, and the sound of your harps will be heard no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make you a bare rock; you will be a place for the spreading of nets. You will be built no more, for I the Lord have spoken,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God to Tyre, “Shall not the coastlands shake at the sound of your fall when the wounded groan, when the slaughter occurs in your midst?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the princes of the sea will go down from their thrones, remove their robes and strip off their embroidered garments. They will clothe themselves with trembling; they will sit on the ground, tremble every moment and be appalled at you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will take up a lamentation over you and say to you,
‘How you have perished, O inhabited one,
From the seas, O renowned city,
Which was mighty on the sea,
She and her inhabitants,
Who imposed her terror
On all her inhabitants!
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Now the coastlands will tremble
On the day of your fall;
Yes, the coastlands which are by the sea
Will be terrified at your passing.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord God, “When I make you a desolate city, like the cities which are not inhabited, when I bring up the deep over you and the great waters cover you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will bring you down with those who go down to the pit, to the people of old, and I will make you dwell in the lower parts of the earth, like the ancient waste places, with those who go down to the pit, so that you will not be inhabited; but I will set glory in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bring terrors on you and you will be no more; though you will be sought, you will never be found again,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you, son of man, take up a lamentation over Tyre;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and say to Tyre, who dwells at the entrance to the sea, merchant of the peoples to many coastlands, ‘Thus says the Lord God,
“O Tyre, you have said, ‘I am perfect in beauty.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Your borders are in the heart of the seas;
Your builders have perfected your beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“They have made all your planks of fir trees from Senir;
They have taken a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Of oaks from Bashan they have made your oars;
With ivory they have inlaid your deck of boxwood from the coastlands of Cyprus.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your rowers;
Your wise men, O Tyre, were aboard; they were your pilots.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The elders of Gebal and her wise men were with you repairing your seams;
All the ships of the sea and their sailors were with you in order to deal in your merchandise.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Persia and Lud and Put were in your army, your men of war. They hung shield and helmet in you; they set forth your splendor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Arvad and your army were on your walls, all around, and the Gammadim were in your towers. They hung their shields on your walls all around; they perfected your beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tarshish was your customer because of the abundance of all kinds of wealth; with silver, iron, tin and lead they paid for your wares.
speaker: Narrator

text: Javan, Tubal and Meshech, they were your traders; with the lives of men and vessels of bronze they paid for your merchandise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those from Beth-togarmah gave horses and war horses and mules for your wares.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Dedan were your traders. Many coastlands were your market; ivory tusks and ebony they brought as your payment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aram was your customer because of the abundance of your goods; they paid for your wares with emeralds, purple, embroidered work, fine linen, coral and rubies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah and the land of Israel, they were your traders; with the wheat of Minnith, cakes, honey, oil and balm they paid for your merchandise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Damascus was your customer because of the abundance of your goods, because of the abundance of all kinds of wealth, because of the wine of Helbon and white wool.
speaker: Narrator

text: Vedan and Javan paid for your wares from Uzal; wrought iron, cassia and sweet cane were among your merchandise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dedan traded with you in saddlecloths for riding.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arabia and all the princes of Kedar, they were your customers for lambs, rams and goats; for these they were your customers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The traders of Sheba and Raamah, they traded with you; they paid for your wares with the best of all kinds of spices, and with all kinds of precious stones and gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Haran, Canneh, Eden, the traders of Sheba, Asshur and Chilmad traded with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traded with you in choice garments, in clothes of blue and embroidered work, and in carpets of many colors and tightly wound cords, which were among your merchandise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ships of Tarshish were the carriers for your merchandise.
And you were filled and were very glorious
In the heart of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Your rowers have brought you
Into great waters;
The east wind has broken you
In the heart of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Your wealth, your wares, your merchandise,
Your sailors and your pilots,
Your repairers of seams, your dealers in merchandise
And all your men of war who are in you,
With all your company that is in your midst,
Will fall into the heart of the seas
On the day of your overthrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“At the sound of the cry of your pilots
The pasture lands will shake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“All who handle the oar,
The sailors and all the pilots of the sea
Will come down from their ships;
They will stand on the land,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they will make their voice heard over you
And will cry bitterly.
They will cast dust on their heads,
They will wallow in ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Also they will make themselves bald for you
And gird themselves with sackcloth;
And they will weep for you in bitterness of soul
With bitter mourning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Moreover, in their wailing they will take up a lamentation for you
And lament over you:
‘Who is like Tyre,
