text: They come to you as people come, and sit before you as My people and hear your words, but they do not do them, for they do the lustful desires expressed by their mouth, and their heart goes after their gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, you are to them like a sensual song by one who has a beautiful voice and plays well on an instrument; for they hear your words but they do not practice them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when it comes to pass—as surely it will—then they will know that a prophet has been in their midst.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel. Prophesy and say to those shepherds, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Woe, shepherds of Israel who have been feeding themselves! Should not the shepherds feed the flock?
speaker: Narrator

text: You eat the fat and clothe yourselves with the wool, you slaughter the fat sheep without feeding the flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who are sickly you have not strengthened, the diseased you have not healed, the broken you have not bound up, the scattered you have not brought back, nor have you sought for the lost; but with force and with severity you have dominated them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were scattered for lack of a shepherd, and they became food for every beast of the field and were scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text: My flock wandered through all the mountains and on every high hill; My flock was scattered over all the surface of the earth, and there was no one to search or seek for them.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: “As I live,” declares the Lord God, “surely because My flock has become a prey, My flock has even become food for all the beasts of the field for lack of a shepherd, and My shepherds did not search for My flock, but rather the shepherds fed themselves and did not feed My flock;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I am against the shepherds, and I will demand My sheep from them and make them cease from feeding sheep. So the shepherds will not feed themselves anymore, but I will deliver My flock from their mouth, so that they will not be food for them.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I Myself will search for My sheep and seek them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a shepherd cares for his herd in the day when he is among his scattered sheep, so I will care for My sheep and will deliver them from all the places to which they were scattered on a cloudy and gloomy day.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bring them out from the peoples and gather them from the countries and bring them to their own land; and I will feed them on the mountains of Israel, by the streams, and in all the inhabited places of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will feed them in a good pasture, and their grazing ground will be on the mountain heights of Israel. There they will lie down on good grazing ground and feed in rich pasture on the mountains of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will feed My flock and I will lead them to rest,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will seek the lost, bring back the scattered, bind up the broken and strengthen the sick; but the fat and the strong I will destroy. I will feed them with judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for you, My flock, thus says the Lord God, ‘Behold, I will judge between one sheep and another, between the rams and the male goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it too slight a thing for you that you should feed in the good pasture, that you must tread down with your feet the rest of your pastures? Or that you should drink of the clear waters, that you must foul the rest with your feet?
speaker: Narrator

text: As for My flock, they must eat what you tread down with your feet and drink what you foul with your feet!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, thus says the Lord God to them, “Behold, I, even I, will judge between the fat sheep and the lean sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you push with side and with shoulder, and thrust at all the weak with your horns until you have scattered them abroad,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, I will deliver My flock, and they will no longer be a prey; and I will judge between one sheep and another.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then I will set over them one shepherd, My servant David, and he will feed them; he will feed them himself and be their shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, the Lord, will be their God, and My servant David will be prince among them; I the Lord have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will make a covenant of peace with them and eliminate harmful beasts from the land so that they may live securely in the wilderness and sleep in the woods.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make them and the places around My hill a blessing. And I will cause showers to come down in their season; they will be showers of blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the tree of the field will yield its fruit and the earth will yield its increase, and they will be secure on their land. Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I have broken the bars of their yoke and have delivered them from the hand of those who enslaved them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will no longer be a prey to the nations, and the beasts of the earth will not devour them; but they will live securely, and no one will make them afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will establish for them a renowned planting place, and they will not again be victims of famine in the land, and they will not endure the insults of the nations anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will know that I, the Lord their God, am with them, and that they, the house of Israel, are My people,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for you, My sheep, the sheep of My pasture, you are men, and I am your God,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir, and prophesy against it
speaker: Narrator

text:
and say to it, ‘Thus says the Lord God,
“Behold, I am against you, Mount Seir,
And I will stretch out My hand against you
And make you a desolation and a waste.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will lay waste your cities
And you will become a desolation.
Then you will know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you have had everlasting enmity and have delivered the sons of Israel to the power of the sword at the time of their calamity, at the time of the punishment of the end,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore as I live,” declares the Lord God, “I will give you over to bloodshed, and bloodshed will pursue you; since you have not hated bloodshed, therefore bloodshed will pursue you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make Mount Seir a waste and a desolation and I will cut off from it the one who passes through and returns.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will fill its mountains with its slain; on your hills and in your valleys and in all your ravines those slain by the sword will fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make you an everlasting desolation and your cities will not be inhabited. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Because you have said, ‘These two nations and these two lands will be mine, and we will possess them,’ although the Lord was there,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore as I live,” declares the Lord God, “I will deal with you according to your anger and according to your envy which you showed because of your hatred against them; so I will make Myself known among them when I judge you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will know that I, the Lord, have heard all your revilings which you have spoken against the mountains of Israel saying, ‘They are laid desolate; they are given to us for food.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And you have spoken arrogantly against Me and have multiplied your words against Me; I have heard it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God, “As all the earth rejoices, I will make you a desolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you rejoiced over the inheritance of the house of Israel because it was desolate, so I will do to you. You will be a desolation, O Mount Seir, and all Edom, all of it. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel and say, ‘O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God, “Because the enemy has spoken against you, ‘Aha!’ and, ‘The everlasting heights have become our possession,’
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “For good reason they have made you desolate and crushed you from every side, that you would become a possession of the rest of the nations and you have been taken up in the talk and the whispering of the people.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord God. Thus says the Lord God to the mountains and to the hills, to the ravines and to the valleys, to the desolate wastes and to the forsaken cities which have become a prey and a derision to the rest of the nations which are round about,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore thus says the Lord God, “Surely in the fire of My jealousy I have spoken against the rest of the nations, and against all Edom, who appropriated My land for themselves as a possession with wholehearted joy and with scorn of soul, to drive it out for a prey.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Israel and say to the mountains and to the hills, to the ravines and to the valleys, “Thus says the Lord God, ‘Behold, I have spoken in My jealousy and in My wrath because you have endured the insults of the nations.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God, ‘I have sworn that surely the nations which are around you will themselves endure their insults.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, O mountains of Israel, you will put forth your branches and bear your fruit for My people Israel; for they will soon come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, I am for you, and I will turn to you, and you will be cultivated and sown.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will multiply men on you, all the house of Israel, all of it; and the cities will be inhabited and the waste places will be rebuilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will multiply on you man and beast; and they will increase and be fruitful; and I will cause you to be inhabited as you were formerly and will treat you better than at the first. Thus you will know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, I will cause men—My people Israel—to walk on you and possess you, so that you will become their inheritance and never again bereave them of children.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Thus says the Lord God, ‘Because they say to you, “You are a devourer of men and have bereaved your nation of children,”
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore you will no longer devour men and no longer bereave your nation of children,’ declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will not let you hear insults from the nations anymore, nor will you bear disgrace from the peoples any longer, nor will you cause your nation to stumble any longer,” declares the Lord God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, when the house of Israel was living in their own land, they defiled it by their ways and their deeds; their way before Me was like the uncleanness of a woman in her impurity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I poured out My wrath on them for the blood which they had shed on the land, because they had defiled it with their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I scattered them among the nations and they were dispersed throughout the lands. According to their ways and their deeds I judged them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the nations where they went, they profaned My holy name, because it was said of them, ‘These are the people of the Lord; yet they have come out of His land.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But I had concern for My holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations where they went.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “It is not for your sake, O house of Israel, that I am about to act, but for My holy name, which you have profaned among the nations where you went.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will vindicate the holiness of My great name which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned in their midst. Then the nations will know that I am the Lord,” declares the Lord God, “when I prove Myself holy among you in their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will take you from the nations, gather you from all the lands and bring you into your own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean; I will cleanse you from all your filthiness and from all your idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit within you; and I will remove the heart of stone from your flesh and give you a heart of flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will put My Spirit within you and cause you to walk in My statutes, and you will be careful to observe My ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will live in the land that I gave to your forefathers; so you will be My people, and I will be your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, I will save you from all your uncleanness; and I will call for the grain and multiply it, and I will not bring a famine on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will multiply the fruit of the tree and the produce of the field, so that you will not receive again the disgrace of famine among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will remember your evil ways and your deeds that were not good, and you will loathe yourselves in your own sight for your iniquities and your abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not doing this for your sake,” declares the Lord God, “let it be known to you. Be ashamed and confounded for your ways, O house of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “On the day that I cleanse you from all your iniquities, I will cause the cities to be inhabited, and the waste places will be rebuilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desolate land will be cultivated instead of being a desolation in the sight of everyone who passes by.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will say, ‘This desolate land has become like the garden of Eden; and the waste, desolate and ruined cities are fortified and inhabited.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the nations that are left round about you will know that I, the Lord, have rebuilt the ruined places and planted that which was desolate; I, the Lord, have spoken and will do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “This also I will let the house of Israel ask Me to do for them: I will increase their men like a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like the flock for sacrifices, like the flock at Jerusalem during her appointed feasts, so will the waste cities be filled with flocks of men. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The hand of the Lord was upon me, and He brought me out by the Spirit of the Lord and set me down in the middle of the valley; and it was full of bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: He caused me to pass among them round about, and behold, there were very many on the surface of the valley; and lo, they were very dry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” And I answered, “O Lord God, You know.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again He said to me, “Prophesy over these bones and say to them, ‘O dry bones, hear the word of the Lord.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God to these bones, ‘Behold, I will cause breath to enter you that you may come to life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will put sinews on you, make flesh grow back on you, cover you with skin and put breath in you that you may come alive; and you will know that I am the Lord.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I prophesied as I was commanded; and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold, a rattling; and the bones came together, bone to its bone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I looked, and behold, sinews were on them, and flesh grew and skin covered them; but there was no breath in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, son of man, and say to the breath, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe on these slain, that they come to life.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I prophesied as He commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they came to life and stood on their feet, an exceedingly great army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel; behold, they say, ‘Our bones are dried up and our hope has perished. We are completely cut off.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore prophesy and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I will open your graves and cause you to come up out of your graves, My people; and I will bring you into the land of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will know that I am the Lord, when I have opened your graves and caused you to come up out of your graves, My people.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will put My Spirit within you and you will come to life, and I will place you on your own land. Then you will know that I, the Lord, have spoken and done it,” declares the Lord.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came again to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you, son of man, take for yourself one stick and write on it, ‘For Judah and for the sons of Israel, his companions’; then take another stick and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim and all the house of Israel, his companions.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then join them for yourself one to another into one stick, that they may become one in your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the sons of your people speak to you saying, ‘Will you not declare to us what you mean by these?’
speaker: Narrator

text: say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, his companions; and I will put them with it, with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in My hand.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: The sticks on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I will take the sons of Israel from among the nations where they have gone, and I will gather them from every side and bring them into their own land;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel; and one king will be king for all of them; and they will no longer be two nations and no longer be divided into two kingdoms.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will no longer defile themselves with their idols, or with their detestable things, or with any of their transgressions; but I will deliver them from all their dwelling places in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them. And they will be My people, and I will be their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “My servant David will be king over them, and they will all have one shepherd; and they will walk in My ordinances and keep My statutes and observe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will live on the land that I gave to Jacob My servant, in which your fathers lived; and they will live on it, they, and their sons and their sons’ sons, forever; and David My servant will be their prince forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make a covenant of peace with them; it will be an everlasting covenant with them. And I will place them and multiply them, and will set My sanctuary in their midst forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: My dwelling place also will be with them; and I will be their God, and they will be My people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the nations will know that I am the Lord who sanctifies Israel, when My sanctuary is in their midst forever.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Son of man, set your face toward Gog of the land of Magog, the prince of Rosh, Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I am against you, O Gog, prince of Rosh, Meshech and Tubal.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will turn you about and put hooks into your jaws, and I will bring you out, and all your army, horses and horsemen, all of them splendidly attired, a great company with buckler and shield, all of them wielding swords;
speaker: Narrator

text: Persia, Ethiopia and Put with them, all of them with shield and helmet;
speaker: Narrator

text: Gomer with all its troops; Beth-togarmah from the remote parts of the north with all its troops—many peoples with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be prepared, and prepare yourself, you and all your companies that are assembled about you, and be a guard for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After many days you will be summoned; in the latter years you will come into the land that is restored from the sword, whose inhabitants have been gathered from many nations to the mountains of Israel which had been a continual waste; but its people were brought out from the nations, and they are living securely, all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will go up, you will come like a storm; you will be like a cloud covering the land, you and all your troops, and many peoples with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “It will come about on that day, that thoughts will come into your mind and you will devise an evil plan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will say, ‘I will go up against the land of unwalled villages. I will go against those who are at rest, that live securely, all of them living without walls and having no bars or gates,
speaker: Narrator

text: to capture spoil and to seize plunder, to turn your hand against the waste places which are now inhabited, and against the people who are gathered from the nations, who have acquired cattle and goods, who live at the center of the world.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheba and Dedan and the merchants of Tarshish with all its villages will say to you, ‘Have you come to capture spoil? Have you assembled your company to seize plunder, to carry away silver and gold, to take away cattle and goods, to capture great spoil?’”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore prophesy, son of man, and say to Gog, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “On that day when My people Israel are living securely, will you not know it?
speaker: Narrator

text: You will come from your place out of the remote parts of the north, you and many peoples with you, all of them riding on horses, a great assembly and a mighty army;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will come up against My people Israel like a cloud to cover the land. It shall come about in the last days that I will bring you against My land, so that the nations may know Me when I am sanctified through you before their eyes, O Gog.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Are you the one of whom I spoke in former days through My servants the prophets of Israel, who prophesied in those days for many years that I would bring you against them?
speaker: Narrator

text: It will come about on that day, when Gog comes against the land of Israel,” declares the Lord God, “that My fury will mount up in My anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: In My zeal and in My blazing wrath I declare that on that day there will surely be a great earthquake in the land of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fish of the sea, the birds of the heavens, the beasts of the field, all the creeping things that creep on the earth, and all the men who are on the face of the earth will shake at My presence; the mountains also will be thrown down, the steep pathways will collapse and every wall will fall to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will call for a sword against him on all My mountains,” declares the Lord God. “Every man’s sword will be against his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: With pestilence and with blood I will enter into judgment with him; and I will rain on him and on his troops, and on the many peoples who are with him, a torrential rain, with hailstones, fire and brimstone.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will magnify Myself, sanctify Myself, and make Myself known in the sight of many nations; and they will know that I am the Lord.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you, son of man, prophesy against Gog and say, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Behold, I am against you, O Gog, prince of Rosh, Meshech and Tubal;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will turn you around, drive you on, take you up from the remotest parts of the north and bring you against the mountains of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will strike your bow from your left hand and dash down your arrows from your right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will fall on the mountains of Israel, you and all your troops and the peoples who are with you; I will give you as food to every kind of predatory bird and beast of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will fall on the open field; for it is I who have spoken,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I will send fire upon Magog and those who inhabit the coastlands in safety; and they will know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “My holy name I will make known in the midst of My people Israel; and I will not let My holy name be profaned anymore. And the nations will know that I am the Lord, the Holy One in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, it is coming and it shall be done,” declares the Lord God. “That is the day of which I have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then those who inhabit the cities of Israel will go out and make fires with the weapons and burn them, both shields and bucklers, bows and arrows, war clubs and spears, and for seven years they will make fires of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will not take wood from the field or gather firewood from the forests, for they will make fires with the weapons; and they will take the spoil of those who despoiled them and seize the plunder of those who plundered them,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On that day I will give Gog a burial ground there in Israel, the valley of those who pass by east of the sea, and it will block off those who would pass by. So they will bury Gog there with all his horde, and they will call it the valley of Hamon-gog.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven months the house of Israel will be burying them in order to cleanse the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even all the people of the land will bury them; and it will be to their renown on the day that I glorify Myself,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “They will set apart men who will constantly pass through the land, burying those who were passing through, even those left on the surface of the ground, in order to cleanse it. At the end of seven months they will make a search.
speaker: Narrator

text: As those who pass through the land pass through and anyone sees a man’s bone, then he will set up a marker by it until the buriers have buried it in the valley of Hamon-gog.
speaker: Narrator

text: And even the name of the city will be Hamonah. So they will cleanse the land.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for you, son of man, thus says the Lord God, ‘Speak to every kind of bird and to every beast of the field, “Assemble and come, gather from every side to My sacrifice which I am going to sacrifice for you, as a great sacrifice on the mountains of Israel, that you may eat flesh and drink blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will eat the flesh of mighty men and drink the blood of the princes of the earth, as though they were rams, lambs, goats and bulls, all of them fatlings of Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you will eat fat until you are glutted, and drink blood until you are drunk, from My sacrifice which I have sacrificed for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will be glutted at My table with horses and charioteers, with mighty men and all the men of war,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I will set My glory among the nations; and all the nations will see My judgment which I have executed and My hand which I have laid on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the house of Israel will know that I am the Lord their God from that day onward.
speaker: Narrator

text: The nations will know that the house of Israel went into exile for their iniquity because they acted treacherously against Me, and I hid My face from them; so I gave them into the hand of their adversaries, and all of them fell by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to their uncleanness and according to their transgressions I dealt with them, and I hid My face from them.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God, “Now I will restore the fortunes of Jacob and have mercy on the whole house of Israel; and I will be jealous for My holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will forget their disgrace and all their treachery which they perpetrated against Me, when they live securely on their own land with no one to make them afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I bring them back from the peoples and gather them from the lands of their enemies, then I shall be sanctified through them in the sight of the many nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will know that I am the Lord their God because I made them go into exile among the nations, and then gathered them again to their own land; and I will leave none of them there any longer.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not hide My face from them any longer, for I will have poured out My Spirit on the house of Israel,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was taken, on that same day the hand of the Lord was upon me and He brought me there.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the visions of God He brought me into the land of Israel and set me on a very high mountain, and on it to the south there was a structure like a city.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He brought me there; and behold, there was a man whose appearance was like the appearance of bronze, with a line of flax and a measuring rod in his hand; and he was standing in the gateway.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man said to me, “Son of man, see with your eyes, hear with your ears, and give attention to all that I am going to show you; for you have been brought here in order to show it to you. Declare to the house of Israel all that you see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, there was a wall on the outside of the temple all around, and in the man’s hand was a measuring rod of six cubits, each of which was a cubit and a handbreadth. So he measured the thickness of the wall, one rod; and the height, one rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he went to the gate which faced east, went up its steps and measured the threshold of the gate, one rod in width; and the other threshold was one rod in width.
speaker: Narrator

text: The guardroom was one rod long and one rod wide; and there were five cubits between the guardrooms. And the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate facing inward was one rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he measured the porch of the gate facing inward, one rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: He measured the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and its side pillars, two cubits. And the porch of the gate was faced inward.
speaker: Narrator

text: The guardrooms of the gate toward the east numbered three on each side; the three of them had the same measurement. The side pillars also had the same measurement on each side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he measured the width of the gateway, ten cubits, and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a barrier wall one cubit wide in front of the guardrooms on each side; and the guardrooms were six cubits square on each side.
speaker: Narrator

text: He measured the gate from the roof of the one guardroom to the roof of the other, a width of twenty-five cubits from one door to the door opposite.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the side pillars sixty cubits high; the gate extended round about to the side pillar of the courtyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the front of the entrance gate to the front of the inner porch of the gate was fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were shuttered windows looking toward the guardrooms, and toward their side pillars within the gate all around, and likewise for the porches. And there were windows all around inside; and on each side pillar were palm tree ornaments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me into the outer court, and behold, there were chambers and a pavement made for the court all around; thirty chambers faced the pavement.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pavement (that is, the lower pavement) was by the side of the gates, corresponding to the length of the gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he measured the width from the front of the lower gate to the front of the exterior of the inner court, a hundred cubits on the east and on the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the gate of the outer court which faced the north, he measured its length and its width.
speaker: Narrator

text: It had three guardrooms on each side; and its side pillars and its porches had the same measurement as the first gate. Its length was fifty cubits and the width twenty-five cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its windows and its porches and its palm tree ornaments had the same measurements as the gate which faced toward the east; and it was reached by seven steps, and its porch was in front of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inner court had a gate opposite the gate on the north as well as the gate on the east; and he measured a hundred cubits from gate to gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he led me toward the south, and behold, there was a gate toward the south; and he measured its side pillars and its porches according to those same measurements.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gate and its porches had windows all around like those other windows; the length was fifty cubits and the width twenty-five cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were seven steps going up to it, and its porches were in front of them; and it had palm tree ornaments on its side pillars, one on each side.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inner court had a gate toward the south; and he measured from gate to gate toward the south, a hundred cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me to the inner court by the south gate; and he measured the south gate according to those same measurements.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its guardrooms also, its side pillars and its porches were according to those same measurements. And the gate and its porches had windows all around; it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were porches all around, twenty-five cubits long and five cubits wide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its porches were toward the outer court; and palm tree ornaments were on its side pillars, and its stairway had eight steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me into the inner court toward the east. And he measured the gate according to those same measurements.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its guardrooms also, its side pillars and its porches were according to those same measurements. And the gate and its porches had windows all around; it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its porches were toward the outer court; and palm tree ornaments were on its side pillars, on each side, and its stairway had eight steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me to the north gate; and he measured it according to those same measurements,
speaker: Narrator

text: with its guardrooms, its side pillars and its porches. And the gate had windows all around; the length was fifty cubits and the width twenty-five cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its side pillars were toward the outer court; and palm tree ornaments were on its side pillars on each side, and its stairway had eight steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: A chamber with its doorway was by the side pillars at the gates; there they rinse the burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the porch of the gate were two tables on each side, on which to slaughter the burnt offering, the sin offering and the guilt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the outer side, as one went up to the gateway toward the north, were two tables; and on the other side of the porch of the gate were two tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: Four tables were on each side next to the gate; or, eight tables on which they slaughter sacrifices.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the burnt offering there were four tables of hewn stone, a cubit and a half long, a cubit and a half wide and one cubit high, on which they lay the instruments with which they slaughter the burnt offering and the sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: The double hooks, one handbreadth in length, were installed in the house all around; and on the tables was the flesh of the offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the outside to the inner gate were chambers for the singers in the inner court, one of which was at the side of the north gate, with its front toward the south, and one at the side of the south gate facing toward the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, “This is the chamber which faces toward the south, intended for the priests who keep charge of the temple;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the chamber which faces toward the north is for the priests who keep charge of the altar. These are the sons of Zadok, who from the sons of Levi come near to the Lord to minister to Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He measured the court, a perfect square, a hundred cubits long and a hundred cubits wide; and the altar was in front of the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me to the porch of the temple and measured each side pillar of the porch, five cubits on each side; and the width of the gate was three cubits on each side.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the porch was twenty cubits and the width eleven cubits; and at the stairway by which it was ascended were columns belonging to the side pillars, one on each side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me to the nave and measured the side pillars; six cubits wide on each side was the width of the side pillar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The width of the entrance was ten cubits and the sides of the entrance were five cubits on each side. And he measured the length of the nave, forty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he went inside and measured each side pillar of the doorway, two cubits, and the doorway, six cubits high; and the width of the doorway, seven cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: He measured its length, twenty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits, before the nave; and he said to me, “This is the most holy place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he measured the wall of the temple, six cubits; and the width of the side chambers, four cubits, all around about the house on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text: The side chambers were in three stories, one above another, and thirty in each story; and the side chambers extended to the wall which stood on their inward side all around, that they might be fastened, and not be fastened into the wall of the temple itself.
speaker: Narrator

text: The side chambers surrounding the temple were wider at each successive story. Because the structure surrounding the temple went upward by stages on all sides of the temple, therefore the width of the temple increased as it went higher; and thus one went up from the lowest story to the highest by way of the second story.
speaker: Narrator

text: I saw also that the house had a raised platform all around; the foundations of the side chambers were a full rod of six long cubits in height.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thickness of the outer wall of the side chambers was five cubits. But the free space between the side chambers belonging to the temple
speaker: Narrator

text: and the outer chambers was twenty cubits in width all around the temple on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text: The doorways of the side chambers toward the free space consisted of one doorway toward the north and another doorway toward the south; and the width of the free space was five cubits all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: The building that was in front of the separate area at the side toward the west was seventy cubits wide; and the wall of the building was five cubits thick all around, and its length was ninety cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he measured the temple, a hundred cubits long; the separate area with the building and its walls were also a hundred cubits long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the width of the front of the temple and that of the separate areas along the east side totaled a hundred cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: He measured the length of the building along the front of the separate area behind it, with a gallery on each side, a hundred cubits; he also measured the inner nave and the porches of the court.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thresholds, the latticed windows and the galleries round about their three stories, opposite the threshold, were paneled with wood all around, and from the ground to the windows (but the windows were covered),
speaker: Narrator

text: over the entrance, and to the inner house, and on the outside, and on all the wall all around inside and outside, by measurement.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was carved with cherubim and palm trees; and a palm tree was between cherub and cherub, and every cherub had two faces,
speaker: Narrator

text: a man’s face toward the palm tree on one side and a young lion’s face toward the palm tree on the other side; they were carved on all the house all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the ground to above the entrance cherubim and palm trees were carved, as well as on the wall of the nave.
speaker: Narrator

text: The doorposts of the nave were square; as for the front of the sanctuary, the appearance of one doorpost was like that of the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: The altar was of wood, three cubits high and its length two cubits; its corners, its base and its sides were of wood. And he said to me, “This is the table that is before the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The nave and the sanctuary each had a double door.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of the doors had two leaves, two swinging leaves; two leaves for one door and two leaves for the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also there were carved on them, on the doors of the nave, cherubim and palm trees like those carved on the walls; and there was a threshold of wood on the front of the porch outside.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were latticed windows and palm trees on one side and on the other, on the sides of the porch; thus were the side chambers of the house and the thresholds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me out into the outer court, the way toward the north; and he brought me to the chamber which was opposite the separate area and opposite the building toward the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: Along the length, which was a hundred cubits, was the north door; the width was fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Opposite the twenty cubits which belonged to the inner court, and opposite the pavement which belonged to the outer court, was gallery corresponding to gallery in three stories.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the chambers was an inner walk ten cubits wide, a way of one hundred cubits; and their openings were on the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the upper chambers were smaller because the galleries took more space away from them than from the lower and middle ones in the building.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they were in three stories and had no pillars like the pillars of the courts; therefore the upper chambers were set back from the ground upward, more than the lower and middle ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the outer wall by the side of the chambers, toward the outer court facing the chambers, its length was fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the length of the chambers which were in the outer court was fifty cubits; and behold, the length of those facing the temple was a hundred cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Below these chambers was the entrance on the east side, as one enters them from the outer court.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, facing the separate area and facing the building, there were chambers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way in front of them was like the appearance of the chambers which were on the north, according to their length so was their width, and all their exits were both according to their arrangements and openings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Corresponding to the openings of the chambers which were toward the south was an opening at the head of the way, the way in front of the wall toward the east, as one enters them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to me, “The north chambers and the south chambers, which are opposite the separate area, they are the holy chambers where the priests who are near to the Lord shall eat the most holy things. There they shall lay the most holy things, the grain offering, the sin offering and the guilt offering; for the place is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the priests enter, then they shall not go out into the outer court from the sanctuary without laying there their garments in which they minister, for they are holy. They shall put on other garments; then they shall approach that which is for the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when he had finished measuring the inner house, he brought me out by the way of the gate which faced toward the east and measured it all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: He measured on the east side with the measuring reed five hundred reeds by the measuring reed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He measured on the north side five hundred reeds by the measuring reed.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the south side he measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned to the west side and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He measured it on the four sides; it had a wall all around, the length five hundred and the width five hundred, to divide between the holy and the profane.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he led me to the gate, the gate facing toward the east;
speaker: Narrator

text: and behold, the glory of the God of Israel was coming from the way of the east. And His voice was like the sound of many waters; and the earth shone with His glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was like the appearance of the vision which I saw, like the vision which I saw when He came to destroy the city. And the visions were like the vision which I saw by the river Chebar; and I fell on my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the glory of the Lord came into the house by the way of the gate facing toward the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner court; and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I heard one speaking to me from the house, while a man was standing beside me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, “Son of man, this is the place of My throne and the place of the soles of My feet, where I will dwell among the sons of Israel forever. And the house of Israel will not again defile My holy name, neither they nor their kings, by their harlotry and by the corpses of their kings when they die,
speaker: Narrator

text: by setting their threshold by My threshold and their door post beside My door post, with only the wall between Me and them. And they have defiled My holy name by their abominations which they have committed. So I have consumed them in My anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now let them put away their harlotry and the corpses of their kings far from Me; and I will dwell among them forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for you, son of man, describe the temple to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities; and let them measure the plan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If they are ashamed of all that they have done, make known to them the design of the house, its structure, its exits, its entrances, all its designs, all its statutes, and all its laws. And write it in their sight, so that they may observe its whole design and all its statutes and do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law of the house: its entire area on the top of the mountain all around shall be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And these are the measurements of the altar by cubits (the cubit being a cubit and a handbreadth): the base shall be a cubit and the width a cubit, and its border on its edge round about one span; and this shall be the height of the base of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the base on the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits and the width one cubit; and from the smaller ledge to the larger ledge shall be four cubits and the width one cubit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The altar hearth shall be four cubits; and from the altar hearth shall extend upwards four horns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the altar hearth shall be twelve cubits long by twelve wide, square in its four sides.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ledge shall be fourteen cubits long by fourteen wide in its four sides, the border around it shall be half a cubit and its base shall be a cubit round about; and its steps shall face the east.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to me, “Son of man, thus says the Lord God, ‘These are the statutes for the altar on the day it is built, to offer burnt offerings on it and to sprinkle blood on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give to the Levitical priests who are from the offspring of Zadok, who draw near to Me to minister to Me,’ declares the Lord God, ‘a young bull for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take some of its blood and put it on its four horns and on the four corners of the ledge and on the border round about; thus you shall cleanse it and make atonement for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also take the bull for the sin offering, and it shall be burned in the appointed place of the house, outside the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘On the second day you shall offer a male goat without blemish for a sin offering, and they shall cleanse the altar as they cleansed it with the bull.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have finished cleansing it, you shall present a young bull without blemish and a ram without blemish from the flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall present them before the Lord, and the priests shall throw salt on them, and they shall offer them up as a burnt offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven days you shall prepare daily a goat for a sin offering; also a young bull and a ram from the flock, without blemish, shall be prepared.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven days they shall make atonement for the altar and purify it; so shall they consecrate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they have completed the days, it shall be that on the eighth day and onward, the priests shall offer your burnt offerings on the altar, and your peace offerings; and I will accept you,’ declares the Lord God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He brought me back by the way of the outer gate of the sanctuary, which faces the east; and it was shut.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to me, “This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no one shall enter by it, for the Lord God of Israel has entered by it; therefore it shall be shut.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the prince, he shall sit in it as prince to eat bread before the Lord; he shall enter by way of the porch of the gate and shall go out by the same way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the house; and I looked, and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house of the Lord, and I fell on my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to me, “Son of man, mark well, see with your eyes and hear with your ears all that I say to you concerning all the statutes of the house of the Lord and concerning all its laws; and mark well the entrance of the house, with all exits of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall say to the rebellious ones, to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Enough of all your abominations, O house of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: when you brought in foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My sanctuary to profane it, even My house, when you offered My food, the fat and the blood; for they made My covenant void—this in addition to all your abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you have not kept charge of My holy things yourselves, but you have set foreigners to keep charge of My sanctuary.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “No foreigner uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, of all the foreigners who are among the sons of Israel, shall enter My sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites who went far from Me when Israel went astray, who went astray from Me after their idols, shall bear the punishment for their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they shall be ministers in My sanctuary, having oversight at the gates of the house and ministering in the house; they shall slaughter the burnt offering and the sacrifice for the people, and they shall stand before them to minister to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they ministered to them before their idols and became a stumbling block of iniquity to the house of Israel, therefore I have sworn against them,” declares the Lord God, “that they shall bear the punishment for their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall not come near to Me to serve as a priest to Me, nor come near to any of My holy things, to the things that are most holy; but they will bear their shame and their abominations which they have committed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I will appoint them to keep charge of the house, of all its service and of all that shall be done in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But the Levitical priests, the sons of Zadok, who kept charge of My sanctuary when the sons of Israel went astray from Me, shall come near to Me to minister to Me; and they shall stand before Me to offer Me the fat and the blood,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “They shall enter My sanctuary; they shall come near to My table to minister to Me and keep My charge.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be that when they enter at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments; and wool shall not be on them while they are ministering in the gates of the inner court and in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Linen turbans shall be on their heads and linen undergarments shall be on their loins; they shall not gird themselves with anything which makes them sweat.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they go out into the outer court, into the outer court to the people, they shall put off their garments in which they have been ministering and lay them in the holy chambers; then they shall put on other garments so that they will not transmit holiness to the people with their garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they shall not shave their heads, yet they shall not let their locks grow long; they shall only trim the hair of their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor shall any of the priests drink wine when they enter the inner court.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall not marry a widow or a divorced woman but shall take virgins from the offspring of the house of Israel, or a widow who is the widow of a priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, they shall teach My people the difference between the holy and the profane, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a dispute they shall take their stand to judge; they shall judge it according to My ordinances. They shall also keep My laws and My statutes in all My appointed feasts and sanctify My sabbaths.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not go to a dead person to defile themselves; however, for father, for mother, for son, for daughter, for brother, or for a sister who has not had a husband, they may defile themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he is cleansed, seven days shall elapse for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the day that he goes into the sanctuary, into the inner court to minister in the sanctuary, he shall offer his sin offering,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And it shall be with regard to an inheritance for them, that I am their inheritance; and you shall give them no possession in Israel—I am their possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall eat the grain offering, the sin offering and the guilt offering; and every devoted thing in Israel shall be theirs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first of all the first fruits of every kind and every contribution of every kind, from all your contributions, shall be for the priests; you shall also give to the priest the first of your dough to cause a blessing to rest on your house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests shall not eat any bird or beast that has died a natural death or has been torn to pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And when you divide by lot the land for inheritance, you shall offer an allotment to the Lord, a holy portion of the land; the length shall be the length of 25,000 cubits, and the width shall be 20,000. It shall be holy within all its boundary round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of this there shall be for the holy place a square round about five hundred by five hundred cubits, and fifty cubits for its open space round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: From this area you shall measure a length of 25,000 cubits and a width of 10,000 cubits; and in it shall be the sanctuary, the most holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be the holy portion of the land; it shall be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to the Lord, and it shall be a place for their houses and a holy place for the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: An area 25,000 cubits in length and 10,000 in width shall be for the Levites, the ministers of the house, and for their possession cities to dwell in.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall give the city possession of an area 5,000 cubits wide and 25,000 cubits long, alongside the allotment of the holy portion; it shall be for the whole house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The prince shall have land on either side of the holy allotment and the property of the city, adjacent to the holy allotment and the property of the city, on the west side toward the west and on the east side toward the east, and in length comparable to one of the portions, from the west border to the east border.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be his land for a possession in Israel; so My princes shall no longer oppress My people, but they shall give the rest of the land to the house of Israel according to their tribes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “Enough, you princes of Israel; put away violence and destruction, and practice justice and righteousness. Stop your expropriations from My people,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall have just balances, a just ephah and a just bath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ephah and the bath shall be the same quantity, so that the bath will contain a tenth of a homer and the ephah a tenth of a homer; their standard shall be according to the homer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The shekel shall be twenty gerahs; twenty shekels, twenty-five shekels, and fifteen shekels shall be your maneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the offering that you shall offer: a sixth of an ephah from a homer of wheat; a sixth of an ephah from a homer of barley;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the prescribed portion of oil (namely, the bath of oil), a tenth of a bath from each kor (which is ten baths or a homer, for ten baths are a homer);
speaker: Narrator

text: and one sheep from each flock of two hundred from the watering places of Israel—for a grain offering, for a burnt offering and for peace offerings, to make atonement for them,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All the people of the land shall give to this offering for the prince in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be the prince’s part to provide the burnt offerings, the grain offerings and the drink offerings, at the feasts, on the new moons and on the sabbaths, at all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel; he shall provide the sin offering, the grain offering, the burnt offering and the peace offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “In the first month, on the first of the month, you shall take a young bull without blemish and cleanse the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall take some of the blood from the sin offering and put it on the door posts of the house, on the four corners of the ledge of the altar and on the posts of the gate of the inner court.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you shall do on the seventh day of the month for everyone who goes astray or is naive; so you shall make atonement for the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, you shall have the Passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day the prince shall provide for himself and all the people of the land a bull for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the seven days of the feast he shall provide as a burnt offering to the Lord seven bulls and seven rams without blemish on every day of the seven days, and a male goat daily for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall provide as a grain offering an ephah with a bull, an ephah with a ram and a hin of oil with an ephah.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the seventh month, on the fifteenth day of the month, at the feast, he shall provide like this, seven days for the sin offering, the burnt offering, the grain offering and the oil.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “The gate of the inner court facing east shall be shut the six working days; but it shall be opened on the sabbath day and opened on the day of the new moon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The prince shall enter by way of the porch of the gate from outside and stand by the post of the gate. Then the priests shall provide his burnt offering and his peace offerings, and he shall worship at the threshold of the gate and then go out; but the gate shall not be shut until the evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of the land shall also worship at the doorway of that gate before the Lord on the sabbaths and on the new moons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burnt offering which the prince shall offer to the Lord on the sabbath day shall be six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the grain offering shall be an ephah with the ram, and the grain offering with the lambs as much as he is able to give, and a hin of oil with an ephah.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the day of the new moon he shall offer a young bull without blemish, also six lambs and a ram, which shall be without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall provide a grain offering, an ephah with the bull and an ephah with the ram, and with the lambs as much as he is able, and a hin of oil with an ephah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the prince enters, he shall go in by way of the porch of the gate and go out by the same way.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the people of the land come before the Lord at the appointed feasts, he who enters by way of the north gate to worship shall go out by way of the south gate. And he who enters by way of the south gate shall go out by way of the north gate. No one shall return by way of the gate by which he entered but shall go straight out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they go in, the prince shall go in among them; and when they go out, he shall go out.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At the festivals and the appointed feasts the grain offering shall be an ephah with a bull and an ephah with a ram, and with the lambs as much as one is able to give, and a hin of oil with an ephah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the prince provides a freewill offering, a burnt offering, or peace offerings as a freewill offering to the Lord, the gate facing east shall be opened for him. And he shall provide his burnt offering and his peace offerings as he does on the sabbath day. Then he shall go out, and the gate shall be shut after he goes out.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you shall provide a lamb a year old without blemish for a burnt offering to the Lord daily; morning by morning you shall provide it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also you shall provide a grain offering with it morning by morning, a sixth of an ephah and a third of a hin of oil to moisten the fine flour, a grain offering to the Lord continually by a perpetual ordinance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they shall provide the lamb, the grain offering and the oil, morning by morning, for a continual burnt offering.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus says the Lord God, “If the prince gives a gift out of his inheritance to any of his sons, it shall belong to his sons; it is their possession by inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he gives a gift from his inheritance to one of his servants, it shall be his until the year of liberty; then it shall return to the prince. His inheritance shall be only his sons’; it shall belong to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The prince shall not take from the people’s inheritance, thrusting them out of their possession; he shall give his sons inheritance from his own possession so that My people will not be scattered, anyone from his possession.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me through the entrance, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers for the priests, which faced north; and behold, there was a place at the extreme rear toward the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the guilt offering and the sin offering and where they shall bake the grain offering, in order that they may not bring them out into the outer court to transmit holiness to the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me out into the outer court and led me across to the four corners of the court; and behold, in every corner of the court there was a small court.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the four corners of the court there were enclosed courts, forty cubits long and thirty wide; these four in the corners were the same size.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a row of masonry round about in them, around the four of them, and boiling places were made under the rows round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to me, “These are the boiling places where the ministers of the house shall boil the sacrifices of the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought me back to the door of the house; and behold, water was flowing from under the threshold of the house toward the east, for the house faced east. And the water was flowing down from under, from the right side of the house, from south of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me out by way of the north gate and led me around on the outside to the outer gate by way of the gate that faces east. And behold, water was trickling from the south side.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the man went out toward the east with a line in his hand, he measured a thousand cubits, and he led me through the water, water reaching the ankles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he measured a thousand and led me through the water, water reaching the knees. Again he measured a thousand and led me through the water, water reaching the loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he measured a thousand; and it was a river that I could not ford, for the water had risen, enough water to swim in, a river that could not be forded.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?” Then he brought me back to the bank of the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when I had returned, behold, on the bank of the river there were very many trees on the one side and on the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to me, “These waters go out toward the eastern region and go down into the Arabah; then they go toward the sea, being made to flow into the sea, and the waters of the sea become fresh.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will come about that every living creature which swarms in every place where the river goes, will live. And there will be very many fish, for these waters go there and the others become fresh; so everything will live where the river goes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will come about that fishermen will stand beside it; from Engedi to Eneglaim there will be a place for the spreading of nets. Their fish will be according to their kinds, like the fish of the Great Sea, very many.
speaker: Narrator

text: But its swamps and marshes will not become fresh; they will be left for salt.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the river on its bank, on one side and on the other, will grow all kinds of trees for food. Their leaves will not wither and their fruit will not fail. They will bear every month because their water flows from the sanctuary, and their fruit will be for food and their leaves for healing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God, “This shall be the boundary by which you shall divide the land for an inheritance among the twelve tribes of Israel; Joseph shall have two portions.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall divide it for an inheritance, each one equally with the other; for I swore to give it to your forefathers, and this land shall fall to you as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This shall be the boundary of the land: on the north side, from the Great Sea by the way of Hethlon, to the entrance of Zedad;
speaker: Narrator

text: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath; Hazer-hatticon, which is by the border of Hauran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The boundary shall extend from the sea to Hazar-enan at the border of Damascus, and on the north toward the north is the border of Hamath. This is the north side.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The east side, from between Hauran, Damascus, Gilead and the land of Israel, shall be the Jordan; from the north border to the eastern sea you shall measure. This is the east side.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The south side toward the south shall extend from Tamar as far as the waters of Meribath-kadesh, to the brook of Egypt and to the Great Sea. This is the south side toward the south.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The west side shall be the Great Sea, from the south border to a point opposite Lebo-hamath. This is the west side.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So you shall divide this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall divide it by lot for an inheritance among yourselves and among the aliens who stay in your midst, who bring forth sons in your midst. And they shall be to you as the native-born among the sons of Israel; they shall be allotted an inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the tribe with which the alien stays, there you shall give him his inheritance,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now these are the names of the tribes: from the northern extremity, beside the way of Hethlon to Lebo-hamath, as far as Hazar-enan at the border of Damascus, toward the north beside Hamath, running from east to west, Dan, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Dan, from the east side to the west side, Asher, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Asher, from the east side to the west side, Naphtali, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Naphtali, from the east side to the west side, Manasseh, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Manasseh, from the east side to the west side, Ephraim, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Ephraim, from the east side to the west side, Reuben, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Reuben, from the east side to the west side, Judah, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And beside the border of Judah, from the east side to the west side, shall be the allotment which you shall set apart, 25,000 cubits in width, and in length like one of the portions, from the east side to the west side; and the sanctuary shall be in the middle of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The allotment that you shall set apart to the Lord shall be 25,000 cubits in length and 10,000 in width.
speaker: Narrator

text: The holy allotment shall be for these, namely for the priests, toward the north 25,000 cubits in length, toward the west 10,000 in width, toward the east 10,000 in width, and toward the south 25,000 in length; and the sanctuary of the Lord shall be in its midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be for the priests who are sanctified of the sons of Zadok, who have kept My charge, who did not go astray when the sons of Israel went astray as the Levites went astray.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be an allotment to them from the allotment of the land, a most holy place, by the border of the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Alongside the border of the priests the Levites shall have 25,000 cubits in length and 10,000 in width. The whole length shall be 25,000 cubits and the width 10,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, they shall not sell or exchange any of it, or alienate this choice portion of land; for it is holy to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The remainder, 5,000 cubits in width and 25,000 in length, shall be for common use for the city, for dwellings and for open spaces; and the city shall be in its midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: These shall be its measurements: the north side 4,500 cubits, the south side 4,500 cubits, the east side 4,500 cubits, and the west side 4,500 cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city shall have open spaces: on the north 250 cubits, on the south 250 cubits, on the east 250 cubits, and on the west 250 cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The remainder of the length alongside the holy allotment shall be 10,000 cubits toward the east and 10,000 toward the west; and it shall be alongside the holy allotment. And its produce shall be food for the workers of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: The workers of the city, out of all the tribes of Israel, shall cultivate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole allotment shall be 25,000 by 25,000 cubits; you shall set apart the holy allotment, a square, with the property of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The remainder shall be for the prince, on the one side and on the other of the holy allotment and of the property of the city; in front of the 25,000 cubits of the allotment toward the east border and westward in front of the 25,000 toward the west border, alongside the portions, it shall be for the prince. And the holy allotment and the sanctuary of the house shall be in the middle of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exclusive of the property of the Levites and the property of the city, which are in the middle of that which belongs to the prince, everything between the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin shall be for the prince.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for the rest of the tribes: from the east side to the west side, Benjamin, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Benjamin, from the east side to the west side, Simeon, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Simeon, from the east side to the west side, Issachar, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Issachar, from the east side to the west side, Zebulun, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the border of Zebulun, from the east side to the west side, Gad, one portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And beside the border of Gad, at the south side toward the south, the border shall be from Tamar to the waters of Meribath-kadesh, to the brook of Egypt, to the Great Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the land which you shall divide by lot to the tribes of Israel for an inheritance, and these are their several portions,” declares the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These are the exits of the city: on the north side, 4,500 cubits by measurement,
speaker: Narrator

text: shall be the gates of the city, named for the tribes of Israel, three gates toward the north: the gate of Reuben, one; the gate of Judah, one; the gate of Levi, one.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the east side, 4,500 cubits, shall be three gates: the gate of Joseph, one; the gate of Benjamin, one; the gate of Dan, one.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the south side, 4,500 cubits by measurement, shall be three gates: the gate of Simeon, one; the gate of Issachar, one; the gate of Zebulun, one.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the west side, 4,500 cubits, shall be three gates: the gate of Gad, one; the gate of Asher, one; the gate of Naphtali, one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city shall be 18,000 cubits round about; and the name of the city from that day shall be, ‘The Lord is there.’”
speaker: Narrator
